propertyId-path.description: The unique identifier Akamai set for your Ion property.
propertyId-path.name: propertyId

fontPreloads.description: List of your site or app's URLs where Adaptive Acceleration is actively preloading fonts.

preconnectHeader.description: As Adaptive Acceleration gathers real-user monitoring data, it identifies commonly loaded headers. These headers are targeted for preconnecting.

problem.description: Represents error data in the [RFC 7807](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7807) Problem Details format.

detail.description: Diagnostic instructions to locate and fix the problem.

httpStatus.description: The HTTP status code that categorizes this error case.

instance.description: Unique value generated with each API call.

title.description: A summary of each error case.

property.description: Encapsulates Adaptive Acceleration report that targets a specific Ion property.

commonPreconnectHeader.description: As Adaptive Acceleration gathers real-user monitoring data, it identifies commonly loaded headers. These headers are targeted for preconnecting.

commonPushedResources.description: List of URLs for which Adaptive Acceleration currently performs a server push.

creationDate.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp representing when the system created the Adaptive Acceleration report.

domainSpecificResources.description: Encapsulates Adaptive Acceleration report rules targeted to a specific domain.

domainSpecificCommonPushedResource.description: List of URLs for which Adaptive Acceleration currently performs a server push.

domainSpecificFontPreloads.description: List of your site or app's URLs where Adaptive Acceleration is actively preloading fonts.

isAbTesting.description: Indicates whether you've enabled [A/B testing](https://techdocs.akamai.com/ion/docs/set-up-adaptive-acceleration#5-optionally-enable-ab-testing) in your Ion property. A/B testing compares two versions of a webpage or app against each other to determine which one performs better.

isActive.description: Indicates whether you've enabled Adaptive Acceleration in your Ion property.

isHttp3Enabled.description: Indicates whether you've enabled HTTP/3 protocol in your Ion property. The [HTTP/3 behavior](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/ga-http3) is automatically included and enabled in the default rule.

lastModifiedDate.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp representing when the system last modified the Adaptive Acceleration report.

lastReset.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp that shows when you [last reset](https://techdocs.akamai.com/adaptive-acceleration/reference/post-property-reset) the Adaptive Acceleration data-gathering report.

pageSpecificRules.description: Encapsulates Adaptive Acceleration property rules targeted to a specific page.

basePageURL.description: This is the URL in question.

experience.description: Data specific to A/B testing results.

isMobile.description: Indicates the page view mode, `true` when the page URL is consumed in the mobile mode, `false` for the desktop mode.

pageSpecificFontPreloads.description: List of your site or app's URLs where Adaptive Acceleration is actively preloading fonts.

pageSpecificPreconnectHeader.description: As Adaptive Acceleration gathers real-user monitoring data, it identifies commonly loaded headers. These headers are targeted for preconnecting.

pageSpecificPushedResources.description: List of URLs for which Adaptive Acceleration currently performs a server push.

version.description: Version of the Adaptive Acceleration rules.

zoneDeployDate.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp representing when the Adaptive Acceleration report were last updated.

pushedResources.description: List of URLs for which Adaptive Acceleration currently performs a server push.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for Akamai's Adaptive Acceleration API

info.description:
View which rules Adaptive Acceleration applies to a property, and
generate new rules.
info.title: Akamai: Adaptive Acceleration API

get.description: Get the current Adaptive Acceleration report for a specific Ion property.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Adaptive Acceleration API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

post.description: Reset the report Adaptive Acceleration uses to define server push and preconnect assets. Adaptive Acceleration reviews current real-user monitoring data to reestablish this report.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Adaptive Acceleration API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
